geninfo.para: On certain vehicles, some of the vehicle electronics may require that power and ground to the device go directly to the batteries. If the vehicle is so equipped, at the battery box you will see the normal heavy positive and negative cables plus lighter gauge feed and ground circuit wires to vehicle electronics.
Whenever performing electrical service which requires disconnecting vehicle batteries, follow the procedure outlined below.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect negative cable(s) from battery terminal.

note.para: If removing crossover cable from batteries, both ends of the cable must be disconnected.

step1.para: Disconnect electronic ground circuit and assure that the ground wire terminal is insulated from all metal surfaces.

caution.para: Failure to disconnect the electronic ground may result in serious damage to the electronic control module.
